dc:title: On Pilgrimage - September 1977
dc:author: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Recounts a visit by her daughter Tamar and granddaughter Katy. Other friends visit as well including Nina Polcyn and Dorothy Gauchat. Day remembers Nina's involvement in a protest in 1934 against the landing of the German liner, Bremen. She also remembers fondly Dorothy Gauchat's husband Bill, of whom Peter Maurin thought highly as well.
